metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11113 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
In ncurses 6.0, there is a NULL Pointer Dereference in the _nc_parse_entry function of tinfo/parse_entry.c. It could lead to a remote denial of service attack if the terminfo library code is used to process untrusted terminfo data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11113` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lib32ncurses6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib32ncursesw6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib32tinfo6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib64ncurses6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib64ncursesw6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
lib64tinfo6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libncurses5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libncurses6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libncursesw5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libncursesw6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libtinfo5 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
libtinfo6 - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-base - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-bin - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-examples - 6.1-1ubuntu1
ncurses-term - 6.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ccdm94> fix availabe in patch 20170701 for ncurses 6.0.

criterions.comment: ncurses package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.1-1ubuntu1').
